mdRecord.dcterms:title: Plan of the Portsmouth & Roanoke Rail-Road and trace of the Petersburg Rail Road / drawn by Thos. H. Williamson Asst. Engr. under the direction of Walter Gwinn, Engineer P & R.R.
Plan of the Portsmouth and Roanoke Rail Road
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Penniman, John, approximately 1817-1850
Portsmouth and Roanoke Railroad Company.
Williamson, Thomas H. (Thomas Hoomes)
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 67 x 52 cm. on sheet 85 x 59 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Shows the area of Southside Virginia, south through eastern North Carolina to Albemarle Sound.
John Penniman was active in Baltimore from 1835 to 1840 according to the Dictionary of artists in America, 1564-1860.
